Let cool slightly before cutting.
Heat oven to 325 degrees f. Place half hens skin side up on broiler pan or in shallow roasting pan. Broil 4 to 6 inches from heat 8 to 10 minutes or until tender, basting occasionally.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange glazed beets in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Combine maple syrup, butter, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the glazed beets. Bake for 10 minutes. Uncover, stir and cook, stirring every 15 minutes, until tender and starting to turn brown, 45 to 50 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl combine all of the ingredients. Form meat mixture into a loaf and place into a casserole dish. Bake for 50-60 minutes. Nice with scalloped potatoes and steamed green beans.

In a large saucepan, heat water over medium high heat. Once water begins to boil, add the tofu. This will rinse the frying oil off and bring the tofu to room temperature. Boil for 3-5 minutes. Remove tofu from the water and drain the saucepan. Place tofu on a towel to dry. Return the saucepan to the stove and add the vinegar, sugar, and salt to it. Simmer until it reaches a slightly syrupy consistency, stirring often. Remove from heat and add remaining ingrediants. Serve in a small dipping bowl alongside tofu.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add green beans and saute till beans are just tender, about 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together soy sauce, minced garlic, honey and ginger. Pour over green beans in skillet and boil until sauce thickens and coats vegetables, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large saute or fry pan until very hot. Add vegetables all at once, spreading in an even layer. Do not stir until bottom of layer begins to brown. Flip and stir to get unbrowned pieces to bottom. Let cook until beginning to brown. The trick here is to keep heat high and brown pieces without overcooking or burning them. If pieces are browned, but not soft enough for your taste, turn off heat and cover pan for a few minutes.

In a large mixing bowl, dissolve sugar and jell-o in 2 cups boiling water. Add to the jell-o mixture the juice of both oranges, the zest of one orange, chopped nuts, and the entire can of crushed pineapple. Shred apples and cranberries. Add to jell-o. Mix well. Chill overnight or until set.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter, shredded hash brown potatoes, sausage links, onion, green pepper, eggs, salt and pepper, cheddar cheese. Cook and stir 4 to 6 minutes, until vegetables are tender and chicken is golden. Mix in california ripe olives, chives, dill, salt and pepper and remove from heat. Divide evenly among 4 plates. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. Let stand for 30 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.

Place tuna in a medium bowl and break into large pieces with a fork. Add tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lime juice, peppers, and salt. Stir to mix. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes or up to 6 hours. Line plates with lettuce leaves and top with tuna salad. Serve with chips.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place apples in a 2-quart square baking dish. Stir in the granulated sugar. For topping, in a medium bowl combine the oats, brown sugar, flour, nutmeg, rolled oats, salt, raisins, apple juice. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the nuts. Sprinkle topping over filling. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until fruit is tender and topping is golden. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 325f. In small saucepan, melt chocolate chips and margarine over low heat, stirring until well blended. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat eggs with whisk until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Heat the oil in a large heavy-bottom saucepan, and stir-fry the onions until transparent. Add the onions and stir well. Cover and simmer for 1 hour, or until onions are tender-crisp. Add salt and nutmeg. Mix well. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray muffin tins with nonstick spray. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Mix in beaten eggs, applesauce and melted butter. Evenly scoop mixture into muffin pans. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Test to see if toothpick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks to cool.

Boil eggs and peel while still warm. Cut eggs lengthwise, remove yolks to a separate bowl. Mash yolks with the cream cheese, then add the relish and the dry mustard. Substitute 2 tsp prepared yellow mustard if dry mustard powder is not available. Stir well. Taste filling and add salt and pepper to taste. Fill whites, either with a teaspoon or get fancy and use a pastry bag with a star. Traditional garnish is a sprinkling of paprika.

Preheat oven to 180c. Spray a medium baking dish with the olive oil spray to coat. Place the halved tomatoes, cut side up, in a single layer in the prepared dish. Sprinkle with the sea salt and lightly spray with more olive oil spray. Bake for 40 minutes or until tomatoes are lightly browned and tender. Meanwhile, combine the vinegar, oil and mustard in a small bowl and set aside. Mix the herbs and feta together and set aside. Bake for

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken, and cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until nicely browned. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and cook for about 8 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through. Remove from heat, and toss in the sun-dried tomatoes, mozzarella and parmesan. Set aside. Cut a deep pocket into the thickest side of each piece of chicken, and stuff a quarter of the spinach mixture into each pocket. Close by pressing flesh together and securing with a wooden toothpick, if necessary. Combine the italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt and pepper, and sprinkles both sides of the chicken pieces with some of the mixture. Wipe out the skillet, add the olive oil, and preheat over medium-high heat. Wipe out the skillet

In a large pot of boiling water, combine dressing ingredients, whisking until smooth. In a large pot of boiling water cook noodles according to package directions, with a slotted spoon transfer noodles to a colander and drain. Rinse under cold running water. Drain well. Return cooking water to a boil. Add shrimp and cook until opaque. Rinse under cold water. Drain. Combine shrimp, dressing and the remaining ingredients with the noodles. Toss to combine. This can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 2 days.

In a crock pot add all ingredients except chicken and potatoes. Whisk until smooth. Add chicken. Cook all day on low or cook on high for 4 hrs. Add potatoes and cook for 1 hour. If you cook all day, warm potatoes in a pan before you put them in soup mixture. Add cream of mushroom soup, milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth, cream cheese, chicken broth

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the pork loins side by side, fat side up in a large heavy roasting pan. Insert an ovenproof meat thermometer in the center of one of the roast. Roast the pork for 30 minutes. Meanwhile in a bowl, crush the rosemary with the olive oil, pepper, vinegar and salt. Spoon the seasoning over the pork. Return the meat to the oven and roast for 30 minutes longer, until the internal temperature is 160 to 165. Remove from the oven, cover loosely with foil and let rest for at least 10 minutes. Thinly slice the meat and arrange on platters. Pour any juices over the meat. Garnish with rosemary springs. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Place beef in crockpot. Add water, soy sauce, beef bouillon cube, bay leaf, garlic powder, dried thyme, dried rosemary, ground black pepper, french rolls, butter. Cover and cook for 5-6 hours on high or until beef is tender. Remove meat from broth, shred with forks and keep warm. Strain broth. Pour broth into cups for dipping. Serve with a slotted spoon on buns. I have also used boneless chicken pieces and cut them up before placing in the crockpot. You just need to adjust cooking time if doing it this way.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Place marinated pork in a roasting pan, and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees f, basting meat often with marinade.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the peas, onion, celery, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, baby peas, cold water, cornstarch, pimiento, and simmer until the peas are tender. Add the peas and cook until the peas are tender. Add

Preheat oven to 350. Spray bottom of baking dish with cooking spray, sprinkle three cups of the has browns in bottom of dish. Layer with ham cheese, bell peppers and mushrooms. Sprinkle remaining potatoes on top. Beat eggs and milk with wire wisk, add cottage cheese and pepper. Pour over mixture in baking pan. Bake 45 min or until golden brown and set in the center.

Heat olive oil in skillet on medium-high heat, add garlic and saute for about a minute. Add tomatoes, jalapenos, cayenne pepper, garlic salt, salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmering boil, reduce heat to medium. Stir in tuna and mix thoroughly. Gently stir in great northern beans and heat through. Serve alone or over rice with a salad and garlic toast.

Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain well. Set aside, and keep warm. Combine chicken broth, fresh gingerroot, soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, chili paste, garlic cloves, spaghetti, green onion, peanuts, peanut butter, honey, chili paste, garlic cloves, spaghetti, green onion, peanuts, peanut butter, honey, chili paste, garlic cloves, spaghetti, green onion, peanuts, peanut butter, honey, chili paste, garlic cloves, spaghetti, green onion, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts, peanuts,

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a baking sheet with vegetable oil spray and set aside. Sprinkle mayonnaise, water and hot pepper sauce in shallow bowl, mixing well. Dip fish in mayonnaise mixture and then dredge in bread crumbs. Place fish on greased baking sheet and bake in oven 17-18 or until fish flakes easily. Serve with lemon wedges.

Heat a large nonstick saut pan over high heat for 2 minutes. Add the chicken, smooth side down. Pan fry for 2-3 minutes, until juices run clear. Turn the chicken over, reduce heat, and cook for 3-6 minutes, until juices run clear. Sprinkle with a little salt and thyme just before serving.

Heat oil on medium heat using a large skillet. Add turkey sausage, cabbage, spaghetti sauce, sliced mushrooms, bell pepper, garlic clove, italian seasoning, onion, salt, pepperpreparation:Heat oil on medium heat using a large skillet. Add turkey sausage, cabbage, spaghetti sauce, sliced mushrooms, bell pepper, garlic clove, italian seasoning, onion, salt, pepperpreparation:Heat oil on medium

Heat oil in a large saute or fry pan until very hot. Add vegetables all at once, spreading in an even layer. Do not stir until bottom of layer begins to brown. Flip and stir to get unbrowned pieces to bottom. Let cook until beginning to brown. The trick here is to keep heat high and brown pieces without overcooking or burning them. If pieces are browned, but not soft enough for your taste, turn off heat and cover pan for a few minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Set the mixture aside. Cream the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract. Once combined, slowly blend in the dry ingredients until evenly mixed. Searate dough into tablespoon-sized balls. Place onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Place on center rack and bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Let the cookies sit for 2 minutes before cooling on wire racks. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Spread nuts evenly over the pan, shaking lightly until all nuts stick. Cool until hard. Break into pieces. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Stir together salt, pepper, chili powder, cumin and cinnamon. Coat the pork with the lime beer marinade. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a 12 inch skillet, over relatively high heat, and brown pork, turning every 30 seconds for 4 minutes. Stir together brown sugar, garlic, and tabasco and pat onto top of the tenderloin. Place pork in roasting pan and cook for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl stir together sour cream, soup, cheese, melted butter, onion, salt and pepper. Gently stir in potatoes. Transfer to greased 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle with cornflakes. Bake, covered, for 40 minutes. Uncover, bake about 15 minutes more until golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Using a baking sheet with a lip, melt butter. Mix seasoning into the butter, and then toss in almonds. Bake in a 350 oven for about 10-12 minutes, stirring once, until nuts are lightly toasted and fragrant. Remove from heat and serve warm or at room temperature.

Put the sliced onions, vinegar, sugar, mustard and celery seeds, and salt in a large metallic pot. Cook at medium-high for 15 minutes. Remove from heat, and add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Gently put the sliced onions, vinegar, sugar, mustard and celery seeds, and salt in a large metallic pot. Cook at medium-high for 15

Mix all ingredients except the basmati rice, water, salt, skim milk, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon. Mix them well and then add the rice and lemon juice. Sprinkle a bit of cinnamon on top. Place in a 8 x 10-inch baking dish and bake at 325 degrees for 50 minutes, or until it is lightly brown and the custard is set. Test with a table knife. Stick it in the center of the dish, and if it comes out clean the dish is baked. This can be served with maple syrup as was done in earlier times or milk will be enjoyed also.

In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and sugar. Temper small amounts of the tapioca into the egg mixture until you have added at least 1 cup. Add this back into the remaining tapioca in the slow cooker. Add the lemon zest and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 15 minutes, stirring at least once. Transfer the pudding to a bowl and cover the surface with plastic wrap. Allow to cool at room temperature for 1 hour and then place in the refrigerator until thoroughly chilled.

Heat olive oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until beans are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Place ham in a 13x9 baking pan. Pour apple cider over ham. In medium bowl stir together remaining ingredients. Spoon sauce over entire ham. Bake, basting every 15 minutes with pan juices for 60 to 70 minutes or until heated through. Serve carved ham with pan juices, garnish with apple slices.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray an 11x7 inch baking dish with pam. Salt and pepper the chicken breast halves and place in the dish. In a bowl, combine the artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic cloves, chicken broth, cream cheese, artichoke hearts, fresh lemon juice, ground red pepper. Mix well. Spread artichoke mixture over chicken breasts. Bake, uncovered, 30-35 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease bottom and side of a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle vegetable mix into pie plate. In medium bowl, stir remaining ingredients until blended. Pour over vegetable mixture. Bake uncovered 35 to 40 minutes in preheated oven or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold water. Shake out excess water and toss pasta with oil. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic powder, milk, tomatoes, black olives, sharp cheddar cheese, salt and pepper. Place pasta in large pot of boiling, salted water until tender, but firm, 8 to 12 minutes, stirring often. Drain well and rinse with cold

Preheat oven to 325f. In small saucepan, melt chocolate chips and margarine over low heat, stirring until well blended. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, beat eggs with whisk until foamy and light yellow in color. Beat in sugar, vanilla, and chip mixture. Add flour, mixing well. Pour into a lightly greased 13x 9-inch pan. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until brownies pull away from pan or until set in center. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Saute the chicken in hot oil for 5-8 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring constantly. Add the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add in the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and cooked pasta. Toss to coat. Cook a couple of minutes or until pasta is heated through. Add in the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, and cayenne pepper

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Arrange sweet potatoes in an even layer in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish. Combine maple syrup, butter, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the sweet potatoes. Toss to coat. Cover and bake the sweet potatoes for 15 minutes. Uncover, stir and cook, stirring every 15 minutes, until tender and starting to turn brown, 45 to 50 minutes more.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and saute until butter is melted. Add parmesan cheese and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add parmes

Combine all ingredients together in a blender. Cover and blend until smooth. Press fruit mixture through a fine-mesh strainer over a bowl to extract juices. Discard solids and pour mixture into 3-ounce paper or plastic drink cups or pop molds. Cover cups with foil. Cut a slit in the foil and insert wooden sticks. Freeze several hours or overnight until pops are firm. Remove from cups or molds to serve.

Combine all ingredients except the meat in a medium bowl. Place the meat in a shallow glass or ceramic dish in one layer. Pour marinade over and turn meat to coat well. Marinate at room temperature for at least 2 hours. Drain meat. Thread on 6 skewers and grill 10 to 12 minutes, turning to cook all sides.

Heat a large saucepan over a low heat and add the butter. When the butter has melted, add the onion and cook until soft and translucent. Add the mushrooms, season with salt and pepper to taste, then increase the heat and stir. When the moisture from the mushrooms has been released, allow it to evaporate, concentrating the flavour. This might happen quickly or slowly, depending entirely on the type of mushrooms used. Add teh paprika and cayenne and fry for a few moments longer, until the paprika turns a shade darker. Finally, add teh sour cream or creme fraiche and dill, and allow it to bubbvle gently for a further 5 minutes or so.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a large mixing bowl, beat butter and sugar together until creamy. Beat in egg and vanilla. Add flour gradually and beat well. Stir in 1 cup morsels. Press on bottom of ungreased 9x13 baking pan. Bake for 30-33 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Immediately sprinkle with the remaining chocolate chips and let sit for 5 minutes or so until the chips become shiny. Then spread evenly over top. Cool completely in the pan and then cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut a 2-inch pocket in the thickest part of each chicken breast. In a small bowl combine the feta and the chopped olives, then stuff of mixture into each pocket. In a nonstick skillet, heat 2 tbs. Olive oil on medium to high heat. Season the chicken with pepper and add it to the skillet, cooking 2 minutes on each side or until brown. Transfer to an oven safe baking dish, drizzled with 1 tbs. Olive oil and add it to the skillet, cooking 2 minutes on each side or until brown. Transfer

Place the asparagus in a large frying pan with about 1 inch of boiling water. Cover with lid and cook for about 6-8 minutes, until the asparagus is tender but still firm. Drain well. Arrange the asparagus spears on a warmed serving dish. Make the tarragon butter by creaming together the remaining ingredients. Heat it gently and pour over asparagus. Serve at once.
Heat oil in a large skillet. Add chicken and zucchini. Saute until tender. Stir in chicken and zucchini mixture. Cover and cook 1 minute, sprinkle zucchini mixture with parmesan cheese, serve warm.

Put the dill dill pickle in a large bowl. Sprinkle with mustard, onion, dill, pickle and eggs add to potatoes stirring in and season with salt and pepper. Adding more mayonnaise to the creaminess you desire. Serve room temperature or chilled.

Place all ingredients in a sauce pot. Cook on high heat until mixture starts to boil. Stirring occasionally until berries pop. Lower heat to medium and using the back of a large wooden spoon, squeeze the berries against the side of pot or use a potato masher to pop grapes, leaving some whole. The pectin from the berries and sugar will thicken the sauce as well as the heat the reducing the mixture.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients and mix well. Press mixture evenly into a loaf pan. Bake uncovered 1 to 1 hours. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a greased 10 x 15 cookie sheet evenly with graham crackers. Combine brown sugar and butter and bring to a boil in microwave or on stovetop. Pour mixture over crackers and sprinkle with nuts and chips. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool in refrigerator. Cut or separate into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place graham crackers close together on large cookie sheet. Mix butter and brown sugar in a 1 quart saucepan. Stir over low heat until butter and sugar are melted together. Stir in almonds and cherries. Spoon mixture over crackers. Bake 8 minutes. Cool about 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely.

Place chicken pieces in a shallow baking dish. Add lemon slices, garlic cloves and rosemary. Roast in a preheated 200c oven for about 35 minutes. You will need to shake the pan from time to time during the cooking process to prevent sticking. Place chicken pieces in a shallow baking dish. You will

Preheat oven to 400f. Place wax paper on a large baking sheet. Combine dry ingredients in a second bowl. Combine other ingredients in a second bowl. Blend the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Add butter and sugar. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes at 170 degrees celsius.

Heat oil in cast iron skillet until it reaches 350 or flour bubbles immediately upon being sprinkled in it. Place the oysters on a large serving platter. Drizzle over the soy and sesame dressing. Sprinkle with the green shallots. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook garlic until tender and fragrant but not browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and mix well. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat and simmer gently for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in dill. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.

Place tortilla in crock pot. Cover with lid and cook for about 10 hours or until meat shreds easily. Remove meat and shred with two forks. Stir the meat with barbecue sauce in a hot skillet on the stove and serve on hamburger buns.

Place amaretto slices in heavy duty zip lock bag. Seal and freeze for 2 hours. Rub the rim of a cocktail glass with lime wedge. Place the salt in a saucer and spin the rim of each glass in the salt and set aside. Process the frozen watermelon, tequila, and next 3 ingredients in blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down the sides. Add the ice and blend well, pour into glasses and garnish if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour a 9 x 9-inch pan. In a bowl, beat together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Combine the cocoa, salt, and flour together. Stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the walnuts. Spread evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm.
Preheat oven to 400f. Spray foil with nonstick cooking spray. Spray foil with

Preheat oven to 200c or 180c fan. Using kitchen scissors or poultry shears, cut down either side of the backbones of chickens and discard. Open out chickens and flatten, pressing with the heel of your hand. Rub chicken skin with cut lemon. Reserve lemons. Combine oil, garlic, oregano, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, cayenne pepper and salt, and rub into skin. Arrange chickens skin side up in a large baking dish and add reserved lemons. Roast for 45 minutes, until golden brown and cooked through. Set aside to rest for 10 minutes, then carve into pieces. Drizzle with reserved pan juices to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease muffin tins or line with paper cups. Combine bran cereal, oat bran, flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl beat the eggs. Beat in buttermilk, honey and oil. Add to dry ingredients and stir just enough to blend. Fold in prunes. Pour into muffin cups and bake 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large mixing bowl stir together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla. On low speed gradually add flour mixture and mix just until blended. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer cookies to cooling racks to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour, or until cheese is bubbling and tater tots are all heated through. Remove from oven, top with desired amount of shredded cheddar, and continue to bake until cheese is bubbling and tater tots are all heated through. Remove from oven, top with desired amount of shredded cheddar, and continue to bake until cheese is bubbling and tater

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl sift together flour and baking soda, set aside. In a large bowl, combine butter and both sugars. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Reduce speed to low, add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Beat until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop heaping spoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto baking trays lined with parchment paper. Bake until golden around the edges and soft in the middle, about 8-10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Stir in melted butter. Press mixture firmly into bottom of a 13 x 9 pan. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup morsels with condensed milk. Microwave on high in 30 second intervals, stirring after each, until melted and smooth. Pour mixture over crumbs. Sprinkle remaining morsels and cashews on top. Bake 20 to 22 minutes, til lightly browned. Let them cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a small saucepan over moderately low heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 2 quart baking dish with cooking spray, set aside. In a large bowl mix together broccoli, soup, one cup of cheese, garlic powder, pepper, salt, milk, 1 cup of french onions, and soy sauce. Pour into baking dish, sprinkle remaining cheese over top. Bake for 25 minutes or until cheese is lightly browned. Sprinkle with rest of french fried onions and bake until onions are browned and cheese is bubbly, about 10 more minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 13x9-inch baking pan. Place bread in the bottom and sprinkle with sausage and cheese. Beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper with a whisk. Pour over the bread mixture. Bake 40-45 minutes or until eggs are set in the center and lightly browned.

Mix all ingredients together in a glass bowl. Place lamb in a extra large heavy-duty plastic bag or glass bowl. Pour the marinade over the lamb, and turn to coat well on all sides. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Place in the fridge for a minimum of 24 hours. When ready to grill, remove from fridge and save marinade for basting if desired. Turn the grill to high heat. Sear both sides for about 5 minutes on each side. Reduce grill temperature to medium heat and finish cooking the lamb. You may baste the lamb with the leftover marinade if desired.

In a blender, combine ice cubes, orange juice, amaretto, southern comfort, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, grenadine, gren

In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Saute the chicken in hot oil for 5-8 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring constantly. Add in the mushrooms, garlic, ginger, and cayenne pepper. Cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add in the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and cooked pasta. Toss to coat. Cook a couple of minutes or until pasta is heated through

Place all ingredients in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process just until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. Be careful not to overprocess. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months. To make hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of the mix in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is powdery -- about 30 seconds. To make hot chocolate, combine 1 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add cabbage, zucchini and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until cabbage is soft but not mushy. Stir in cooked egg noodles and bacon and additional soy sauce if preferred.

Heat the oil in a medium saucepan, over medium high heat. Add the onion, water, sugar, salt and saffron to the pan and bring to a boil over medium high heat, then reduce heat to medium low, partially cover the pan and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from heat and let stand 5 minutes without removing lid. Fluff with a fork and stir in the pistachios just before serving.

In a 4-quart saucepan, over medium-high heat, bring the water, cranberries, sugar, apricots, currants, raisins & vinegar to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat & simmer, stirring occasionally, until cranberries begin to pop, 5-8 minutes. Meanwhile, peel the tangerines, removing & discarding the peel & white fibers. Discard the seeds, then separate the segments & coarsely chop them. Add the chopped tangerines & the juice to the pan, & simmer to blend flavors, 2-3 minutes. Stir in pecans, then cool to room temperature & serve. Or chill & serve. Can be kept in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 3 days, or frozen for up to 1 month.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat 1 t oil in a ovenproof skillet until it just shimmers. Add the salmon skin side down and cook until the skin begins to crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Mound the salt around and over each piece, trying to get it to really make a cohesive crust on each one. Roast in oven for 5 minutes per inch of thickness. Remove the salmon from the oven and let sit for 2 minutes in the crust. Carefully brush away the salt. Transfer to a clean work surface and finish removing salt with a pastry brush. Season with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil, fresh ground black pepper, and serve with a little lemon. The salmon will seem a little dry but will not be overcooked. This really brings out the flavor of the salmon.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

This step will take approximately 20 minutes, so preheat oven to 350 degree f. In a large pot cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Return to pot. Add milk, melted butter, pepper, and salt. Stir in cheeses. Transfer to a greased 2-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes. Carefully stir mixture. Sprinkle with crushed crackers. Bake 5 minutes more or until crackers are browned and mixture is just heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion slices, garlic, and mushrooms. Stir to combine. Pour over meat. Cover slow-cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve meat and sauce over noodles.

In 1 quart saucepan, combine sugar and cornstarch. Gradually stir in water until smooth. Cook over medium heat, stirring often until boiling. Boil 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice, zest, beaten egg yolks, butter and milk. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold into lemon mixture. Pour into buttered 6 cup casserole dish. Place this casserole inside a large pan. Pour hot water into the 9x13 pan to a depth of about 1 inch. Bake at 350 degrees for about 40 minutes or until the topping is set and golden brown. During baking this separates into a cake-like topping with a lemon sauce beneath.

Heat pasta according to pkg instructions. Meanwhile, heat oil in lg skillet or dutch oven. Add garlic. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add tomatoes, beans, italian seasoning and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add spinach. Cook 3 minutes. Put drained pasta on serving plates. Top with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with feta and olives.

In a medium saucepan cook maple glazed carrots, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. Remove carrots from pan. In the same saucepan combine butter, brown sugar, and salt. Cook and stir about 2 minutes or until glazed.

Place the first 7 ingredients in a mixer, mixing till blended. Stir in the remaing ingredients. Spoon on to a parchment lined cookie sheet pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove and let set for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium bowl mix sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper, honey, oil. Add pecans and toss well. Drizzle honey and oil over spiced nuts and mix well so they are evenly coated. Spread on greased baking sheet and bake 7 - 10 minutes until sugar is caramelized. Let it cool for 5 minutes and take it of the sheet otherwise they might stick to the bottom. If that happens put it back in oven to melt the sticky sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Sift flour with sugar, soda salt and cinnamon into a large bowl or food processor by pulsing 3-4 times. Mix in shortening and knead thoroughly. Shape into balls using 1 tablespoon of dough. Place on ungreased baking sheets and make a depression in the top with the thumb. Press a blanched whole or sliced almond into the center of each cookie. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes. Makes six dozen.

Boil water in a large saucepan over high heat. When water comes to a rapid boil, turn off heat, put the tea bags into water and cover. After the tea has steeped about 1 hour, pour the sugar into a 2-quart pitcher, then add tea. The tea should still be warm so the sugar will dissolve easily. Add lemon juice. Chill. Makes 2 quarts.
In a large pot, add vegetables, soup mix, bouillon cube and cover with water. Season as desired. Boil rapidly for ten minutes. Lower heat and simmer until vegetables are tender.

Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add green beans and saute till beans are just tender, about 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together soy sauce, minced garlic, honey and ginger. Pour over green beans in skillet and boil until sauce thickens and coats vegetables, about 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Heat oil in a wok until very hot. Stir fry celery ribs for 2 to 3 minutes. Add broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots and saut on medium heat adding cup of water can help steam the vegetables. Cover pan for about 2 minutes. Cover for 1 to 2 minutes. Then uncover and saut until done ideally 1 more minute to keep veggies crisp. Salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place cream cheese in a medium sized mixing bowl. Saute onions in butter until softened. Add onions, seafood, wine and swiss cheese to cream cheese. Stir until combined. Spread into a greased 2 quart baking dish and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400, grease 2 quart casserole dish. In prepared casserole dish, place chicken, broccoli and cheese. In a separate mixing bowl, blend baking mix, milk, eggs, salt and pepper on high speed until well mixed. Pour into dish over chicken, broccoli and cheese. Bake for 35-40 minutes until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.

Combine greens, red onion, fresh ground black pepper, kosher salt, dried cranberries, satsuma oranges, sliced almonds, blue cheese, poppy seed dressing in a large bowl. Season with black pepper. Toss gently to combine. Whisk oil, juice and salt and pepper together in a small bowl until well combined. Add mayo to cranberries. Now add blue cheese to cranberries. Add mayo to blue cheese. Now add blue cheese to blue cheese

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Put the first 7 ingredients into a food processor bowl. Pulse until bread is very coarsely chopped, 4-6 times. Grease an 8 inch square baking dish and arrange the cherry tomatoes in a single layer. Sprinkle with the bread crumb mixture. Bake until crust is browned and tomatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add melted butter and almond extract. Beat well. Add flour. Stir in cranberries and pecans. Fill muffin pan. Since these do not raise much fill the cups to the top. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until browned on top and done in center. Cool on wire rack.

Heat the oil in a large non stick fry pan. When it is hot, add the thighs in one layer and saute them over medium to high heat for 4 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Remove the chicken to a platter. Add the onions to the dripping in the pan. Saut for 1 minute. Stir in the garlic, wine and coriander stems only and saut for 1 minute longer. Return the chicken to the pan, add lemon salt and pepper. Bring the surrounding liquid to the boil. Cover the pan, reduce the heat and boil gently for 15 minutes. Stir in the coriander leaves and serve 2 thighs per person. Serve with rice or cous cous.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments. Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate if desired.

Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill until mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon. Fold in three-fourths of the cool whip. Pour into a 13x9 inch pan. Chill for 4 hours or until firm. Cut into squares. Garnish with remaining cool whip.

Place the tofu in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 5 minutes. Drain well. Chill uncovered in the refrigerator until cool enough to handle. Crumble tofu into a food processor and add remaining ingredients. Blend until a very thick, smooth paste forms, stopping to scrape down the sides of the work bowl as necessary. Cover and chill several hours or overnight in order to allow the flavors to blend before serving. Keeps 5 to 7 days in the refrigerator.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except bread and butter. Mix until the cornstach is disolved. Transfer mixture to a shallow bowl or pan. Dip both sides of each bread slice into the mixture. Melt butter on the griddle or skillet. Place bread on heated surface and cook each side to a light golden brown. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees celsius. Butter 9 inch fluted or plain tube pan. In large bowl of electric mixer, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, eggnog, and vanilla. Stir together flour, bakng powder, and salt. Gradually beat into butter mixture. Prepare topping by combining nuts, sugar and cinnamon. Scatter half the topping evenly over bottom of pan. Spoon in half batter. Add remaining topping and spoon on remaining batter. Bake 50 to 60 minute, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Mix all ingredients together and place them in a casserole dish. Cover with crushed potato chips and sprinkle with paprika. Bake uncovered at 350f. For about 30 minutes or until heated through and chips are lighty brown.

In small saucepan, combine pudding mix and gelatine. Add water and lemon juice. Stir until smooth. Cook and stir 1-2 minutes longer or until thickened. Remove from the heat. Cool clightly. Pour into crust. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Spread with whipped topping.

In 4-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in butter 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until tender. Stir in flour, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Stir in broth, broccoli and corn. Heat to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender. Stir in half-and-half. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray 2 loaf pans with non stick coating. In a large bowl, mix flour, splenda, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl mix together the eggs and egg whites, canola oil, and the grated zucchini. Stir the liquid mixture into the flour mixture. The dough will be somewhat thick. Stir until the flour mixture is just moistened. Spread evenly into the loaf pans. Bake 50 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, cook and stir bacon and onion until bacon is crisp. Drain off fat. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into ungreased 1-quart casserole. Bake uncovered until hot and bubbly, about 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove skin from chicken breasts and place in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish. Place the chicken in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper to taste. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Bake, uncovered, at 350-degrees for 1 hour or until tender and cooked through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, toss potatoes, garlic, and olive oil together to coat. Place potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt or pepper to taste. Place in 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender, allow to cool for 10 minutes. Combine mayonnaise, creole mustard, lemon juice, parsley, and scallions. Add to potatoes. Add salt or pepper to taste. Place in 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, onions and garlic, salt and pepper to taste. Saute to desired doneness. Add tomato sauce, and simmer for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley you can serve this on rice, or as a side dish, hot or cold or luke warm. You can put this on a ham sandwich. Yummm. You can put this in an omelette and top with mozzarella and parmesan. You can add hot sauce or peppers to your liking. This is very versatile.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add bacon, red potatoes, onion, green pepper, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the oil is melted. Add the bacon, italian seasoning and parsley and cook, stirring occasionally, until the oil is melted. Add the bacon, italian seasoning and parsley

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Prepare muffin mix as directed on package, including adding the blueberries. Pour half of the batter into a greased 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. To prepare the filling, in a separate mixing bowl, beat together cream cheese, almond extract, sugar, lemon juice and egg until smooth. Spread the cream cheese filling over the layer of muffin batter in the pan. Pour the remaining batter on top of the filling. To make the streusel topping stir together melted butter, flour, sugar, chopped nuts and cinnamon. Sprinkle streusel topping over the top of the batter. Bake at 375 degrees f. For 35 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into middle comes out clean. Cool, then refrigerate before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a large glass baking dish with foil,. Put the ground beef in a large bowl and add the onion and garlic, knead together, add bread crumbs and italian seasoning -- mix all together. Add the egg and milk -- knead together well with hands --. Form pieces of meat into 1 inch balls, place in baking dish -- bake for about 20-30 minutes --. I usually put them in a large pan on the stove and cover with spaghetti sauce for a few minutes at medium heat, but thats optional.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray 9x13 pan with non-stick cooking spray. Arrange tenderloins in pan and sprinkle with mozzarella. In seperate bowl, mix tomatoes, chicken stuffing, and water. Mix until stuffing is moistened. Spread evenly over chicken. Bake for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.

Heat oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Add potatoes, onions, eggs, milk, baking powder, fresh spinach, hard cheese. Cover pan with lid and turn heat down to medium-low. Check after about 3 minutes and see if omelette has set - the middle should not jiggle. Add salt and pepper to taste.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Cook garlic until tender and fragrant but not browned, about 1 minute. Add shrimp and mix well. Pour in stock and bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat and simmer gently for 20 to 25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in dill. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, mix together rice, cream of celery soup, butter, frozen green beans, mushrooms, swiss cheese. Stir, in potatoes and kielbasa. Spoon into a 7x11 inch casserole dish. Place casserole on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 90 minutes or until potatoes are tender and flavors blended.

Preheat oven to 425f. Spray a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish with nonstick pan coating or grease lightly with solid shortening. Cut baked potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Place half in a prepared baking dish. Sprinkle half of the salt, pepper and bacon. Top with half of the sour cream & cheese. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 425 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with chopped green onions to garnish.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease or line cookie tray. Mix together sugar and butter. Add egg yolk and vanilla, mix well. Stir in flour and choc chips. Place teaspoonfuls onto tray and bake for 12 minutes.

Place baguettes in a large bowl, cover with foil-lined baking sheet. Coat baguettes with cooking spray and season with salt and pepper. Preheat broiler. Cook baguettes 10 to 12 minutes or until fish is opaque. While fish is cooking, combine avocado, sour cream, mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic, hot-pepper sauce, worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper in a food processor. Process, scraping down bowl occasionally, until mixture is creamy and smooth. Serve a dollop of sauce next to each baguette.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake romaine lettuce for 30 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Remove from oven and let

Preheat oven to 450. Toss corn and oil to coat and spread out on a large baking sheet. Bake, stirring once, until some kernels begin to brown, about 20 minute. Combine garlic, rosemary, and beef. Brown beef on all sides, then add shallot, red wine vinegar, and balsamic vinegar. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove beef with tongs and place in a bowl quickly saut arugula in remaining juices for approximately 5 seconds. Remove beef with tongs and place in a bowl quickly saut arugula in remaining juices

Heat oil in a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat. Add turkey burgers and cook 4 to 6 minutes per side, until cooked through. Serve the cheese-stuffed burgers with this meal and refrigerate remaining burgers until ready to use. Serve burgers on rolls.

Heat butter and oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook for a further 30 seconds. Add garlic and cook for a further 30 seconds. Add stock. Simmer for 15 minutes. Cool slightly before pureeing. Return to the heat and stir in the yoghurt. Serve drizzled with cream and with pappadums.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms and sauté for about 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook for another 5 minutes. Add

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Mix all ingredients in lg bowl. Mix well. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with whipped cream. Refrigerate leftovers.

Cream butter and sugar. Add sifted dry ingredients. Roll into balls and place on a greased oven tray and flatten. Place a chocolate button in the centre of each biscuit. Bake for 15 - 20 minutes at 175c.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Combine turkey meat, chilies, onion, soup. If desired, spread tortillas with butter. Cut each tortilla in half and arrange 6 halves over bottom of a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Spread a third of the turkey mixture over tortillas, top with a third of the cheese. Reapeat layers of tortillas, turkey, and cheese two more times. Carefully pour the chicken broth over all. Cover and bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated throughout and bubbly. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Cut in squares with sharp knife and use a spatula to remove each serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread chops or full rack of ribs in roasting pan. Mix honey mustard, ketchup, lemon and herb spice, and dices garlic. Spread mixture over meat. Place cut onion over meat and sauce. Spinkle black pepper over entire dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes, until tender. Serve with your choice of vegetables for a little sweeter sauce add granulated sugar to taste.

Place salmon in 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients and pour over salmon. Turn salmon so that it gets coated with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Bake in preheated 425 f oven for 10-12 minutes, or until fish flakes easily and is opaque in centre.

Place the marshmallows on a small cookie sheet. Place under your broiler in the oven for 2 to 3 minutes, until toasted or charred. The charred flavor, as we all know from campfires, is ideal. If necessary, reheat the hot chocolate over low heat, stirring constantly. Pour the hot chocolate into four demitasse cups. Top each with a toasted gooey marshmallow and serve immediately with spoons.

In a large microwave-safe bowl combine the white sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup and peanut putter. Microwave on high for 3-4 minutes or until melted, stirring once. Stir in vanilla. Fold in rice cereal and the chopped peanuts until well combined. Spread into a lightly buttered 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish. Cover and chill for 1 hour or until set. Cut into squares.

In a large pot or dutch oven heat oil over medium-high heat. Add scallions, celery, and onions, stir until vegetables are wilted, approximately 5 minutes. Add broth and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and add peas, stir until vegetables are wilted, approximately 5 minutes. Remove from heat and carefully transfer to bowl of food processor or blender, do this in batches if necessary. Add

Heat 1 cup of the milk in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add chocolate, stirring constantly, until melted. When the chocolate has melted, increase heat to medium and add the remainder of the milk while whisking rapidly. Do not allow to boil. Serve in small cups fortified with a jigger of peppermint schnapps and a dollop of whipped cream. Add a peppermint stick to stir. If transporting in a thermos, heat thermos up with hot water to get it warm for 1 minute. Pour water out and fill with hot chocolate.

In a small saucepan on medium heat, warm the vinegar and sugar together until the sugar dissolves. Set liquid aside to cool. Chop the dill. Slice the cucumber very thinly and arrange in layers on a shallow, non-reactive platter with sloped edges. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and garnish with the fresh dill. Pour the dressing over the cucumbers. Let marinate at least 1 hour or overnight. Yield is estimated.

Heat the oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu and stir fry for 3 minutes. Add vegetable stock and continue cooking until it is reduced by half only takes a minute. Add soy sauce, turn off heat and mix well. Season to taste. Garnish with green onion tops& serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut off the ends of the brussels sprouts and pull off any yellow outer leaves. Mix them in a bowl with the olive oil, salt, and lemon-pepper seasoning. Transfer them to a sheet pan and roast for 35 to 40 minutes, until crisp outside and tender inside. Shake the pan from time to time to brown the brussels sprouts evenly. Sprinkle with more kosher salt, if you like, and serve hot.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugars. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Preheat oven to 180deg c. Beat egg whites and sugar together for 1 minute. Stir baking soda into apple sauce and then add to bowl. Gently fold in flour, rind and choc chips alternately with orange juice. Pour into prepared loaf tin. Bake 30- 35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Using a baking sheet with a lip, melt butter. Mix seasoning into the butter, and then toss in almonds. Bake in a 350 oven for about 10-12 minutes, stirring once, until nuts are lightly toasted and fragrant. Remove from heat and serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion slices, garlic, and mushrooms. Stir to combine. Pour over meat. Cover slow-cooker and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve meat and sauce over noodles.

In a resealable storage bag thoroughly combine all ingredients except the flank steak, when combined add flank. Seal bag, turn to coat. Place in the refrigerator and marinate 24 hours, turning bag occasionally. Remove meat from marinade and discard marinade. Grill to desired doneness, about 6 minutes per side for medium rare. Transfer steak to work surface and let stand 5 minutes. Cut across grain into thin strips. Arrange on platter and serve.

Heat oven to 400f. Mix first six ingredients and form into cocktail size meatballs. Place on jelly roll style pan with lip. Bake meatballs in oven for 15-20 minutes until done. Melt butter in saucepan. Add garlic and saut for 1-2 minutes. Stir in chicken broth and cook until thickened. Combine meatballs and sauce. Keep warm in crockpot if serving for party.

Place chicken on top of low calorie greens. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or until juices run clear. Stir in the chicken. Cover and cook on high for 20-30 minutes or until juices run clear. Stir

In a small bowl, combine 2 cups water, sugar, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, and cool completely. Stir in lemon juice and remaining 2 cups water. Refrigerate. Serve chilled over ice. Garnish with maraschino cherries, fresh mint, and lemon slices, if desired.

In a large skillet, cook the rice in oil over medium-high heat, stirring, until golden brown. Add salt, water, bouillon and soy sauce. Cover tightly and simmer 20 minutes longer or until all liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, melt butter and olive oil together. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet. Stir until potatoes are evenly coated with spice mixture and onion slices are evenly distributed. Cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes, tossing and turning the potatoes every few minutes. Potatoes will be done when slightly browned and fork-tender.

Heat olive oil in a medium skillet, add garlic, and cook over medium-low heat until just starting to brown, 2 to 5 minutes. Add olives and thyme. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring often, 3 to 4 minutes. Add tomatoes, cook over medium-low heat until juices thicken a bit and flavors are combined, 5 to 8 minutes. Season to taste with pepper. Serve this colorful an. Just before serving, stir in the parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, stir together butter, garlic, cheese and parsley. Remove biscuits from container. On baking pan with sides, make 2 loaves of 5 biscuits each. Set the biscuits on their sides, just touching each other end to end, like they were in the can, only in 2 groups of 5. Split each biscuit in half. Separate biscuits into 20 pieces, then cut biscuits into 4 pieces. Toss biscuits with bacon and other ingredients. Put all this into tube pan and drizzle with butter. Bake for 25-30 minutes.

Cook noodles in a large pot of lightly salted water until al dente. While the pasta is cooking, place the eggs, grated cheese, parsley, salt and pepper into a mixing bowl and beat with a whisk until well combined. When the noodles are almost cooked, melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Quickly drain the pasta and add it to the skillet. Toss briefly to coat it with the butter. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and using a flat wooden spoon, mix quickly together for less than a minute until the eggs and noodles become creamy and thick. Do not cook the eggs too long or they will scramble and ruin the dish. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray 9 by 13-inch casserole dish with pam. Put colby-monterey jack cheese, bacon, flour, eggs, milk, horseradish, pie crusts, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese, cream cheese,

In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in sweetened condensed milk, lemon juice, and vanilla. Lightly swirl pie filling into cream cheese mixture. Spread on top of cake. Top cake with strawberries. Be careful to not put too much of the juice on the cake, or else it will be too moist. Refrigerate for an hour.

In a large saucepan combine the chocolate, cream, butter and butter and heat over medium heat, stirring, until chocolate is completely melted. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl and chill for 4 hours, or until firm. Form mixture by heaping teaspoons into balls and roll lightly in peanuts. Chill on a baking sheet lined with wax paper for 1 hour, or until firm. Keep in an airtight container, chilled, for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a bowl. Set the mixture aside. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Let the cookies sit for 2 minutes before cooling on wire racks.

In large, resealable plastic bag, or shallow glass container, combine the first seven ingredients and mix well. Add steak, turn to coat. Seal bag, or cover container, and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Drain and discard marinade. Grill, covered, over medium-hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until meat reaches desired doneness.

Preheat oven to 400f line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and spray with non-stick cooking spray. Coat a small saucepan with non-stick cooking spray. Over medium heat, cook and stir garlic until soft, about 3 minutes. Mix in white wine, honey, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Simmer, uncovered, for about 3 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Arrange salmon fillets on foil-lined baking sheet. Brush fillets with balsamic glaze, and sprinkle with oregano. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 14 minutes, or

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Butter six muffin cups. In a small saucepan, melt the butter and add the syrup. Remove the crusts from the bread. Flatten each slice with a rolling pin. Brush both sides of each slice with the syrup mixture. Put one slice into each cup and sprinkle the bacon pieces in the cups. Break an egg into each cup and bake until the eggs are set. Start checking after about 5 minutes. Lift the toast cups from the pan and serve immediately, drizzled with additional syrup, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine apples, pecans, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, vanilla, brown sugar, sugar, pecans, butter, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool on a rack, then cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 2 hours. Remove from the heat and add pecans. Mix well and pour into crust. Bake for approximately

Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Drain well, then return potatoes to the pot. Add the butter, milk and salt and mash well. Stir in parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl mix all dry ingredients. Add milk and water and add-ins of your choice. Using your fingers knead into an elastic dough. If you need more flour just add it and if you need more liquid add more water or milk. Flatten the dough to desired thickness and cut out scones of desired size. Place scones on a paper-lined baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In buttered casserole dish, place cleaned and trimmed chicken breasts, and season with salt and pepper, if desired. Pour italian salad dressing over to coat and let marinate in the fridge for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. After the hour of marinating, turn chicken breasts over and sprinkle evenly with oregano and grated parmesan cheese. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 1 hour, checking after 45 minutes to make sure they do not get over-cooked.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray muffin tins with nonstick spray. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a bowl. Mix in beaten eggs, applesauce and melted butter. Evenly scoop mixture into muffin pans. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Test to see if toothpick comes out clean.

Put strawberries in a blender and blend until the berries are just mashed up. Add the other remaining ingrediets and blend for 30 seconds or so. Place strawberries in a blender and blend until the berries are just mashed up. Add the other remaining ingredients and blend for 30 seconds or so. Place

Preheat oven to 425f. Peel, core and thinly and thickly slice the apples. Toss with lemon juice if using. Combine and mix apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour into crust-lined pie plate. Dot with butter. Place top crust, seal and vent. Cover edges of crust with narrow band of aluminum foil, shiny side out. Bake at 425f for 20 minutes. Reduce temperature to 375f and bake another 30-40 minutes until filling is bubbling and crust is nicely browned. If necessary remove foil last 10 minutes to brown edges. Remove foil last 10 minutes to brown edges. Remove

Place beef in slowcooker. Add sliced onions. Mix together the vegetable juice, brown gravy mix, garlic, pepper and thyme. Pour liquid mix over beef in slowcooker. Cover with the lid and cook on low for about 7-8 hours or until desired doneness.

Trim the bottoms off of the brussels sprouts and then cut in half vertically. Fry bacon in a large pan until crispy. Remove from pan and reserve the fat. Add the brussels sprouts to the bacon fat and fry on medium. Do not stir too often as they need to brown. Sprinkle with the salt. Once the brussels sprouts are browned, add the green onion. Crumble the bacon and add to the brussels sprouts. Stir together the juice of the lemon and the sugar. Pour juice over the brussels sprouts and cook until evaporated.

Heat 1 tbs oil in a saute pan over medium-high heat. Fry lentils until crisp and reddish-brown, about 10 minutes, then drain on paper towels. Put garlic and chile in saucepan and fry for 20 seconds or until just beginning to brown. Add lentils and water. Partially cover and cook for 30-35 minutes, or until lentils are soft. Serve lentils with onions on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix the first six ingredients for crust. Place half of mix in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake crust for 10 minutes. Melt caramels and whipping cream. Place chocolate chips over baked crust, drizzel caramel over chips, then place the remaining crust mixture on top of the caramel. Bake another 10-15 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool.

Combine all dry ingredients together. Cut in shortening. Add flour, butter, baking powder, salt and pepper with as much flour as will fit. Pulse, adding the rest of the flour in batches, until all is coarsely chopped. Bake until bubbling, 25-30 minutes. Remove foil, and continue baking until golden, 15-20 minutes more. Remove foil, and continue baking until golden

In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, combine the sugar, salt, butter and milk. Bring to a boil, then boil for 1 full minute. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter, oats, vanilla and chocolate milk mix. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Let stand until completely cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Mix all ingredients in lg bowl. Mix well. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake another 40 min, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Garnish with pecans if desired.

Heat water in a large nonstick sauce pan, over medium heat. Add the cauliflower, onion, garlic, celery ribs, diced tomatoes, red curry paste, vegetable broth, coconut milk, milk, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and simmer until all ingredients are well cooked. Using an immersion blender, puree all ingredients to desired smoothness and return to heat. Lower temperature and add milk and coconut milk. Heat through and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Combine flour and sugar in a large bowl or food processor. Add margarine and process, or mix together with your fingers, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add cold water, one tablespoon at a time, and process, or mix, until a manageable dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll into a 12-inch circle. Press dough into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan or removable-bottom tart pan. Prick the bottom all over with a fork, cover dough with foil and fill with dried beans or rice. Bake 10 minutes. Remove beans and foil and bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes more. Remove from oven and cool completely on a wire rack. Yields 8 slices per crust.

In a large skillet, heat the oil and garlic over medium heat. Add chicken and water and cook 10 minutes or until browned. Add more water if necessary to prevent chicken from getting too dry. Set chicken aside. Pour off fat and water. Add remaining ingredients. Heat to a boil. Return chicken to pan. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.

Heat oil in a five to six quart pot over moderately high heat. Add garlic and pepper flake, saute until golden. Be careful not to burn the garlic. Stir in tomatoes and salt. Simmer uncovered for 35 minutes. Serve with pasta.

In a large non-stick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook beef and peppers over medium heat until meat is no longer pink, drain. Stir in the salsa, corn, and water and bring to a boil. Stir in tortilla strips, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until meat is no longer pink, drain. Sprinkle with cheese, cover and cook 2-3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream.
Combine sugar and water and bring to the boil. Simmer 5 minutes to make a syrup. Allow to cool. Combine berry puree with lemon juice and syrup. Place in a metal bowl or tray. Freeze till set.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the filipino rice in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari.

Combine the coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk together the salad dressing, vegetable oil, sugar substitute, vinegar, and salt in a medium bowl. Blend thoroughly. Pour dressing mixture over coleslaw mix and toss to coat. Chill at least 2 hours before serving.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Add to skillet. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted.

In a large saucepan, combine water and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in berries. Cook until the berries have mostly broken down, approximately 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and lemon juice. Enjoy.

In small bowl, combine all dressing ingredients. Beat at low speed until smooth. Cover and refrigerate for several hours to blend flavors. Combine salad ingredients in large bowl. Serve on a bed of mangoes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line a greased 9x9 pan with bread. Combine broccoli with margarine, cheese, salt, tobasco, and onion. Spoon over bread. Beat eggs, add milk powder and water, mix well, pour over broccoli. Bake at for 20-25 minutes.

Place a steamer basket in a saucepan filled with one-inch of water. Bring to a gentle boil. Add potatoes. Cover and cook just until tender, 15-20 minutes. Toss occasionally. In a serving bowl, combine vinegar and dijon. Season with salt and pepper, and toss.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place sliced apples in an 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Sprinkle water over apples. Mix rest of ingredients in a bowl until you get a crumble. Spread crumble mixture over apples. Bake uncovered about 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined.

In a large saucepan, bring the water and sugar to a light boil. Cook and stir for 2 mins. Pour into a large container. Add boiling water, sugar, lemon juice, cranberry-strawberry drink and blend until smooth. Squeeze and remove tea bag and add tea to berry mixture, blending until smooth. Adjust consistency with additional water, if needed and sweeten with honey, if desired. Makes 1 large or 2 small servings.
